DML-PLR with single-hidden-layer MLP (nnet engine)

Source: R/dml-nnet.R
dml_nnet.Rd

Uses a small MLP for both nuisances. Adds dummy encoding for nominal X and normalizes numeric predictors (recommended for NNs).

Usage

dml_nnet(
  data,
  y,
  d,
  x,
  folds_outer = NULL,
  n_folds = 5,
  n_rep = 1,
  vcov_type = "HC2",
  hidden_units_m = NULL,
  hidden_units_g = NULL,
  penalty = 0.001,
  epochs = 200,
  max_weights = 5000,
  trace = FALSE,
  store_models = FALSE
)

Arguments

data, y, d, x

As in dml_rf()

folds_outer

Optional rsample rset. If NULL, folds made internally (stratified on D).

n_folds

Number of outer folds when folds_outer is NULL.

n_rep

Number of repetitions when folds_outer is NULL.

vcov_type

Sandwich variance type (e.g., "HC2" or "HC3").

hidden_units_m, hidden_units_g

Hidden units for m- and g-models (NULL = heuristic).

penalty

L2 penalty (a.k.a. weight decay).

epochs

Max iterations (passed to nnet::nnet() via parsnip).

max_weights

Max allowable weights for nnet engine (MaxNWts) to avoid overflow.

trace

Logical; print nnet training trace.
